WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I noticed that the latest version of WabbitEMU is consuming a lot of CPU-power.
Not immediately, but definitely after a few minutes, CPU-usage of WabbitEMU jumps up to the range of 50%.
Is anyone else experiencing this as well?

What can I do to provide more information concerning this issue?
* Log-files, which, how?
* Settings, which, how?

My system:
* W8 Professional
* TI-84 ROM v2.55

Cheers,
Stephan

Comments.Message:
Additional information:
It'd seem that the increased CPU-usage occurs on my 32-bit W8-Pro notebook and NOT on my 64-bit W8-Pro desktop PC. Maybe this could be of help narrowing down the issue.
Stephan

I've done some quick tests and haven't been able to reproduce the issue, so I'll need to narrow it down. I don't have a 32-bit machine, so I can't test on one but I'm curious if you are using the 32 bit or 64 bit version of Wabbit on your 64 bit machine. If you are using the 64 bit version can you try the 32 and see if you can reproduce the issue that way?
Also, is there anything specific you need to do to create the issue. For example if you close all instances of Wabbit, then reopen a new one and let it sit does the CPU just jump up after a few minutes? If I had to guess, I would say that the root cause is related to keypresses. When using Wabbit do you normally press the keys or click on the skin? Let me know if you can reproduce the issue without doing anything, and if not, what are the simplest steps you can go through to recreate it.
Another thing to check would be to turn off the cutout mode (the borderless window). It is known to use more CPU on lower end systems and may be exacerbating the issue. Try seeing if you can recreate the issue without it.

Thanks for the report,
BuckeyeDude

I use the 32-bit version of WabbitEmu on both the 64-bit Desktop and the 32-bit Notebook, as well as a PortableApps USB-stick which I use at school.

Further info on the problem (on my W8-32bit Notebook):
* CPU-usage climbs quite rapidly immediately after startup, without any user interaction
* high CPU-usage occurs with Cutout Skin (my default View)
* high CPU-usage occurs with Windowed Skin
* high CPU-usage occurs in the same way without Skin

Notebook specs - Summary:
		Operating System

		CPU
